article_metadata.article_headline: Rayan Cherki's stats this season compared with Cole Palmer and Phil Foden and there's a clear winner
‘I can be ruthless’: Ruben Amorim warns United of tough times ahead

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: I can be ruthless when I have to be. If you think as a team I will be the nicest guy that you have ever seen, if there is someone just thinking that, I will be a different person. I’m not that kind of guy that wants to show that he is a boss. They will feel it in the small details. I can be the smiling one, but then when you have a job to do I will be a different person, and they understand that.
quotes.summary: I can be ruthless; if you expect me to be nice all the time, you'll see a different side.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: It’s so much harder to come to a team in the middle of the season, because you have to know the players during the games, so you are talking about no national-team periods to work with the players – it’s just games.
quotes.summary: Joining mid-season makes it tough to get to know the players, as there’s no downtime for training.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: Where you can improve a team is in training; this is the most important aspect. You can tell the players to recover and to react really fast but if you don’t make any exercise with that it’s really hard to do it on video or during recovery training but we will find ways to try to cope.
quotes.summary: Improvement comes from training; we need practical exercises to be effective.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: It’s hard to copy someone, so I have to be me. I’m not the best person to show the history of Manchester United. It should be the club first and also me, because I’m always paying attention to those details and try to focus our players on the history of the club, but not the recent history.
quotes.summary: I need to be authentic; my focus is on the club's history, not just its recent past.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: You have to be very demanding. This is a club that needs to win, it has to win – we have to show that to our players. It’s a different time; I cannot be the same guy Sir Alex Ferguson was. I have to have a different approach but I can also be demanding with a different approach. That is my focus.
quotes.summary: I must be demanding; this club needs to win, and I have to adapt my approach.

article_metadata.article_headline: Ferguson to Ten Hag: How Manchester United’s new managers fared on debut

quotes.speaker: Alex Ferguson
quotes.raw_quote_text: [Reflecting on his debut match] "It was a nightmare trying to concentrate with so much media attention and so many cameramen on top of me. They [the players] were a bit uptight and they wanted to do well."
quotes.summary: It was tough for me to focus with so much media pressure, and the players were anxious to perform well.

quotes.speaker: Rio Ferdinand
quotes.raw_quote_text: "The season’s started and we are really looking forward to it. We see the things said in the media and every next person is tipping someone else to win the league and putting us in third or fourth place."
quotes.summary: We're excited for the season and aware of what others are saying about us in the media.

quotes.speaker: Erik ten Hag
quotes.raw_quote_text: [After his first match] "It’s a hell of a job."
quotes.summary: It's a challenging role.

quotes.speaker: José Mourinho
quotes.raw_quote_text: "Respect, respect, respect."
quotes.summary: I demanded respect.

article_metadata.article_headline: Ruben Amorim eyes golden chance as he enters Manchester United vortex

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: The only thing I ask: hard work and you have to believe in the new idea. And I felt that. Until they prove me wrong, I believe in the players.
quotes.summary: I ask for hard work and belief in a new idea; until proven otherwise, I trust the players.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: I don’t know about repair but we have space to grow as a team. We have to improve in a lot of areas: the understanding of the game, I know it’s a different way of playing, and we are changing in the middle of the season.
quotes.summary: We have room to grow and need to improve our game understanding and adapt to changes mid-season.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: We have to improve the physical aspect. And that’s it. I don’t know how long it will take. I know when you are in Manchester United you have to win games. So I will not tell you that I need a lot of time.
quotes.summary: We need to improve physically, but I won't claim we need a lot of time to start winning.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: It’s not revolution because football is not so different with five players in the back, three players in the back or four players in the back. I cannot say evolution because we will have to wait and see but we will play a different type of football.
quotes.summary: We're not revolutionizing but will play a different style of football.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: I can tell you in the small things I can help these players a lot.
quotes.summary: I can significantly assist these players with the small aspects.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: I’m different. You looked at Mourinho and you felt he can win everywhere. He was European champion. I’m not European champion. I’m a different guy in a different moment.
quotes.summary: I’m not Mourinho; I'm a different coach in a different time.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: Football nowadays is different and I am the right person at the moment. I am a young guy, I understand the players, so I try to use that to help my players.
quotes.summary: As a young coach who understands players, I believe I'm suited for today's football.

article_metadata.article_headline: Ruben Amorim believes Manchester United are years away from the title

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: No, of course not. Call me naive but I believe I am the right guy at the right moment. I could be wrong but the Earth still will turn, the sun will rise again. It doesn’t matter, I’m not worried about that. I truly believe I’m the right guy for this job.
quotes.summary: I don't see this as an impossible job; I believe I'm the right person for it.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: I’m a little bit of a dreamer, and I believe in myself, I also believe in the club. We have the same idea, the same mindset, so that can help, but I truly believe in the players also.
quotes.summary: I have faith in myself, the club, and the players.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: I have two years and a half. In two years you can understand if I am the right manager to go in this process. We will need more time.
quotes.summary: My current contract isn't enough to gauge my ability fully; we need more time.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: You have to believe and I believe in them. The only thing I ask is hard work and you have to believe in the idea.
quotes.summary: Belief and hard work are key; I trust the players.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: When players don’t win games, you start to be suspicious of the way of playing. You can understand when they walk to the game or the warm-up if they are confident or not.
quotes.summary: Players lose confidence when results aren't good, and it shows.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: As a coach you have to choose one way or another. I always choose 100% our way. I choose to risk a bit. I believe so much in our way of playing, they will believe too.
quotes.summary: I fully commit to my chosen style of play and expect the team to follow.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: It is all together, but the final word should be the manager, not because it is your right but because it is your responsibility.
quotes.summary: The manager should have the final say in player recruitment due to responsibility.

article_metadata.article_headline: ‘He’s ready’: Ruben Amorim’s rapid rise from obscurity to Premier League

quotes.speaker: José Embaló
quotes.raw_quote_text: [Speaking about Amorim's departure] When he said in front of the group he was leaving, I saw 10, 12 teammates crying. I went to shake his hand and hug him, and he said: ‘I’m so sorry but keep working. You never know what life is waiting for you.’
quotes.summary: Amorim's departure from Casa Pia moved many teammates to tears.

quotes.speaker: José Embaló
quotes.raw_quote_text: Adélio and Carlos Fernandes, they were very loyal to him. They have so much talent to be a top coach. I was 25, while Adélio and Carlos Fernandes were 22, 23. But their minds were so big on football that I learned a lot from them. I really appreciate the way they see football – they showed me age doesn’t matter.
quotes.summary: Embaló admired the talent and maturity of Amorim's coaching staff.

quotes.speaker: José Embaló
quotes.raw_quote_text: He’s part of the family, he treats you with all the respect. At that time, to see him as an older brother who knows a lot of football and the love you see in his eyes, the love he has for football.
quotes.summary: Amorim was respected and seen as a family figure by his players.

quotes.speaker: José Embaló
quotes.raw_quote_text: [Regarding a specific game] He called me to one side, and he said: ‘Look, José, I know your feelings, but that doesn’t matter. Don’t worry about that, I really need you in this game, but coming from the bench.’ That was a change. I started to appreciate him more. He made me feel that when I was on the bench, I was more important than who was starting.
quotes.summary: Amorim reassured Embaló about his role, which changed Embaló's perspective.

quotes.speaker: José Embaló
quotes.raw_quote_text: As a player, when you see the person first and then you see a coach. You just appreciate the time you have together and enjoy.
quotes.summary: Embaló valued the personal connection he had with Amorim as a coach.

quotes.speaker: Pedro Russiano
quotes.raw_quote_text: [Speaking about Amorim's versatility] Sometimes he [Morais] put Ruben right-back or central defender or midfielder, defensive midfielder or No 8 or No 10, and he always knew how to play in this position.
quotes.summary: Russiano commented on Amorim's adaptability in different positions on the field.

quotes.speaker: Pedro Russiano
quotes.raw_quote_text: [Discussing a past match against Amorim's team] The secret to winning 1-0 was to put pressure on the three defenders because he [Amorim] didn’t have Viktor Gyökeres back then.
quotes.summary: Russiano explained his tactical approach in a match against Amorim's team.

quotes.speaker: Pedro Russiano
quotes.raw_quote_text: I don’t know if he will be a success in Manchester, but he arrives at United with them down, like it was when he moved to Sporting. This is a special thing why Ruben takes Manchester United. He’s ready for this.
quotes.summary: Russiano expressed confidence in Amorim's readiness for the Manchester United role.

article_metadata.article_headline: Forging new Manchester United identity is my key task, claims Ruben Amorim

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: [On the identity of Manchester United] We know that we need time, but we have to win time. To win time is to win games. But the most important thing for me is identity. So since day one we will start with our identity.
quotes.summary: I believe we need time to succeed, but we must start winning and focus on establishing our identity.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: [On the club's history] That’s for sure. That’s why we are Manchester United. That’s why we are … a long time ago, we don’t win the Premier League. But if you ask, Manchester United is the biggest club in England. So this is part of the history, it is not now. So we have to address that, to show that and to try to win again.
quotes.summary: It's clear to me: Manchester United's rich history motivates us to reclaim our status as the biggest club in England.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: [Regarding his excitement about the club’s future] When Manchester United talked to me, Omar, they told me about their plans and you get excited.
quotes.summary: When I heard Manchester United's plans, I felt a surge of excitement.

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: [On feeling at home] It’s hard to explain. It’s strange because it’s a feeling of belonging at the first day. And I know that it’s going to be tough. I know it’s a massive challenge, but I feel quite relaxed. I feel at home and I think that is important in the beginning. So, I’m very excited.
quotes.summary: I can't quite describe it, but I felt a sense of belonging from day one despite knowing the challenges ahead.

quotes.speaker: Ruud van Nistelrooy
quotes.raw_quote_text: To everyone at Manchester United Football Club, in particular the backroom staff, the players and the fans, I want to thank you from the bottom of my heart for your incredible efforts and support. It has been a privilege and honour to represent the club as a player, coach and manager, and I will always cherish the memories we have shared together.
quotes.summary: I deeply thank everyone at Manchester United for their support; it's been an honor to represent this club.

article_metadata.article_headline: Manchester United’s Bruno Fernandes helps unwell passenger during flight

quotes.speaker: Susanna Lawson
quotes.raw_quote_text: (Witnessing the incident) At some point during the flight, Bruno got up and went to the back, presumably to the toilet. After a couple of minutes, we heard: ‘Can we get help? We need help. Can we get some assistance?’
quotes.summary: I heard Bruno call for help during the flight.

quotes.speaker: Susanna Lawson
quotes.raw_quote_text: (Describing the scene) We turned around and Bruno was there and a gentleman looked like he was passing out and Bruno had caught him. The other stewards went running up the plane to help and luckily there was a spare seat right at the back, so they all got the gentleman into the seat. Bruno stayed with him, for, I think – I lost track of time – five or 10 minutes.
quotes.summary: Bruno caught a man who was passing out and stayed with him.

quotes.speaker: Susanna Lawson
quotes.raw_quote_text: (Reflecting on the situation) What an absolutely lovely man. He did it and didn’t make a big deal out of it. [The air stewards] just called for help and help came.
quotes.summary: Bruno was very composed and didn't seek attention for his actions.

quotes.speaker: Susanna Lawson
quotes.raw_quote_text: (After the flight) I basically said to Bruno: ‘What you did back there was really lovely, it was great that you were there to be able to help’.
quotes.summary: I thanked Bruno for his kindness during the incident.

quotes.speaker: Susanna Lawson
quotes.raw_quote_text: (On supporting Manchester City) The ridiculous thing is we’re a blue family – we support Manchester City.
quotes.summary: Interestingly, my family supports Manchester City.

article_metadata.article_headline: Ruud van Nistelrooy leaves Manchester United as Ruben Amorim checks in

quotes.speaker: Manchester United statement
quotes.raw_quote_text: Ruud is, and always will be, a Manchester United legend. We are grateful for his contribution and the way in which he has approached his role throughout his time with the club. He will always be very welcome at Old Trafford.
quotes.summary: Ruud will always be a legend at Manchester United, and we appreciate his contributions.

quotes.speaker: Matthijs de Ligt
quotes.raw_quote_text: (Discussing tactical adaptation) I think a back three or a back four, it’s in general the same – the only thing of importance is how the team is set up. You can play in a back three but if everything is not compact and everybody is doing their own job then it’s going to be really difficult, the same in a back four. That’s going to be the biggest challenge for the trainers, to get everyone on the same wavelength and same page to improve as a team and improve as players.
quotes.summary: Whether it’s a back three or four, success hinges on team setup and collaboration.

article_metadata.article_headline: Will Amorim change Manchester United or will his style alter due to the squad?

quotes.speaker: Ruben Amorim
quotes.raw_quote_text: [After a Champions League match] United cannot play the way we play, they cannot be so defensive.
quotes.summary: I believe United shouldn't play as defensively as my team does.
